pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the following equiv: 
```lean
def Ideal.associatesNonZeroDivisorsEquivIsPrincipal : 
    Associates R‚Å∞ ‚âÉ {I : (Ideal R)‚Å∞ // IsPrincipal (I : Ideal R)}
```
and also a `MulEquiv` version.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #12768
- [x] depends on: #12777
- [x] depends on: #13177

bors d+

:v: xroblot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9889587082/job/27315986823)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9889587082/job/27315987569)
Why do you prefer this theorem to be here? It is not about a ring homomorphism, I find it more appropriate for `Basic`. The question actually applies to all the new lemmas that you are adding.

Well, the new lemmas have to be in this file since otherwise I need to modify the imports in `Ideal.Basic`. Also they are closely related to `Ideal.associatesEquivIsPrincipal`, so I have decided to move it to this file. Finally, all these results are about `maps` on ideals so the file `Ideal.Maps` seemed more adequate :wink:
Can this be upgraded to a mul equiv (or something like that, it also presevers `0`)?

I could add the instance 
```lean
instance : MonoidWithZero {I : Ideal R // IsPrincipal I}
```
and then proving that it is `MulEquiv` is easy. I don't think there is a `MulEquivWithZero` but adding a separate lemma that states that is equal to zero iff zero should easy too.
Maybe a sensible thing to do is to define the submonoid of principal ideals. I don't think it is a lot of work.

Sure. I have a question though [Ideal.span_singleton_mul_span_singleton](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Ideal/Operations.html#Ideal.span_singleton_mul_span_singleton) is defined in `Ideal.Operations` so there are several possibilities: 

1. Define the submonoid of principal ideals in this file, but then `associatesEquivIsPrincipal` has to be moved there too and @faenuccio maybe not like that :wink:
2. Move `Ideal.span_singleton_mul_span_singleton` to `Ideal.Maps` but it feel weird to separate it from a bunch of related results
3. Create new file `Ideal.IsPrincipal` and put everything related to principal ideals there.
4. ...
I guess creating a new file is a good idea, and quite cheap.

My plan is to create a new file`Ideal.IsPrincipal` and move everything (basic) related to `Ideal.span_singleton` and `Ideal.IsPrincipal` (aka `Submodule.IsPrincipal`) in this file. Before I do it though, I want to make sure we are in agreement about this. 
The other option would be to only put in this new file things about the submonoid of principal ideals, but then that file would need to imports all other basic `Ideal` files.
I am traveling until Monday evening, so maybe you can ask on Zulip. In my opinion more files is a good idea.

I am certainly all in favour of creating `Ideal.IsPrincipal` because many results are quite specific to principal ideals and they deserve a separate file. Especially if this will move these results out of `Ideal.Map` :wink:
Well, I'll go ahead and see what it looks like first.

Hum, things are getting a lot more complicated than I thought and I do not think that moving everything about `span_singleton` in a `IsPrincipal` file is going to work.  I am going to explore a less ambitious option.
I opened #13177 which is provides an easier solution

```suggestion
  simpa only [associatesEquivIsPrincipal, Equiv.ofBijective_apply,
    span_singleton_eq_span_singleton] using Associates.mk_quot_out x
```

```suggestion
theorem associatesEquivIsPrincipal_mem_nonZeroDivisors_iff {x : R} :
```
Would you like to add a (simp) lemma saying that the effect of `associatesEquivIsPrincipal` on a non-zero-divisor is the same as the effect of `associatesNonZeroDivisorsEquivIsPrincipal`?
Don't you mean the other way around?
That is simplify from `associatesNonZeroDivisorsEquivIsPrincipal` to `associatesEquivIsPrincipal`?
Yes, sure, I am sorry: I meant to "connect" them in the right way, that is the one you propose.
This holds without `Nontrivial R`.

```lean
open scoped nonZeroDivisors in
theorem Ideal.span_singleton_nonZeroDivisors {R : Type*} [CommSemiring R] [NoZeroDivisors R]
    {r : R} : span {r} ‚àà (Ideal R)‚Å∞ ‚Üî r ‚àà R‚Å∞ := by
  cases subsingleton_or_nontrivial R
  ¬∑ exact ‚ü®fun _ _ _ ‚Ü¶ Subsingleton.eq_zero _, fun _ _ _ ‚Ü¶ Subsingleton.eq_zero _‚ü©
  ¬∑ rw [mem_nonZeroDivisors_iff_ne_zero, mem_nonZeroDivisors_iff_ne_zero, ne_eq, zero_eq_bot,
      span_singleton_eq_bot]
```
Indeed! Thanks.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add a version of `Ideal.associatesEquivIsPrincipal` for generators that are non-zero-divisors

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberField/CanonicalEmbedding/FundamentalCone): Prove equivalence with principal ideals
